--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Beachcomber gently laid Redhot's head to the ground. He thought to
> himself for a second. He didnt have quite the expertise of Ratchet, 
or
> Hoist. But he was better at this than he was at fighting. He opened 
his
> chest compartment, and ordered his computer to convert some of his 
own
> energon into a cube. He then placed it into Redhot's hand, hoping it
> would be enough for now. He then activated his geological
equipment, 
and
> monitered Redhot's head, for anything unusual, magnetic 
interferance,
> mocrobes, etc.


    ::REDHOT::

    The look of desperation in Redhot's eyes when the energon was 
placed in his hand spoke volumes. He weakly nibbled at it, resting 
between feeble laps. The energy helped him stabilize his
concentration 
and it gave him the strength to give Beachcomber a thankful smile.
    He gathered some strength to study Beachcomber's geological 
equipment. He gave it a wary eye. The tools looked alien, but that
was 
likely due to Redhot's condition. He wished he could see straight. 
    It was then he felt the energy around him. He gasped. He hadn't 
covered his trail..anyone a world away could read his signature. He 
tried to will the trail away but it would not respond to his
commands. 
Maybe that was what the stranger studied. Either that or he was 
picking up Redhot's electromagnetic field. It was readable when he
was 
under stress and was strongest in his head and shoulders.
    Redhot sighed. He lay back his head and closed his eyes. He
wished 
his situation would go away.

 Northlight
Domnijoe Productions

**************************
